general.title: Clark and Mackinlay join more than 70 Tory MPs saying they will stand down at the election – UK politics live
general.description:
• - More than 70 Tory MPs, including Clark and Mackinlay, are planning to stand down at the upcoming election.
  • - Energy secretary Claire Coutinho welcomed Ofgem's decision to lower the energy price cap by 7%.
  • - Shadow energy secretary Ed Miliband criticized the Tories for being out of touch with the cost of living crisis.
  • - Miliband praised Rishi Sunak for taking bold decisions and winning arguments.

general.title: Students at two universities pack up pro-Palestine camps – as it happened
general.description:
• - Taiwan's representative to Australia, Douglas Hsu, expressed interest in engaging in critical-minerals trade with Australia.
  • - Hsu highlighted the scale of Australia's mining industry and intentions to bring more Taiwanese businesses to work with Australian partners.
  • - The focus is on preventing harm to children, intervening early to break cycles of violence and abuse.

general.title: Sex crimes detective found guilty of sexually touching woman in NSW police station without her consent
general.description:
• - Sex crimes detective Glen Coleman found guilty of sexually touching a 19-year-old woman without her consent
  • - Acquitted of raping the woman but convicted of abusing his position of public office for his own sexual gratification
  • - The incidents occurred from March to May 2022
  • - Coleman was accused of sexually assaulting the woman and abusing his position as a New South Wales police officer

general.title: ‘Crisis in dental care’: Bernie Sanders on his fight for better teeth for Americans
general.description:
• - Bernie Sanders' bill aims to improve access to oral healthcare by adding dental benefits to Medicare and enhancing them in Medicaid.
  • - The bill targets 115 million older and lower-income Americans who struggle to afford dental care.
  • - Despite America's reputation for a "Hollywood smile," millions face difficulties accessing basic dental care.
  • - Statistics show that one in five US seniors have lost all their natural teeth, nearly half of adults have gum disease, and cavities are a common reason for children missing school.

general.title: Post Office Horizon IT inquiry: tearful Vennells’ claim she worked as hard as she could dismissed as ‘absolute rubbish’ – live
general.description:
• - Victims' lawyer responds to tearful monologue by former Post Office chief executive
  • - Chair Wyn Williams confirms timetable for the day
  • - Edward Henry KC and Sam Stein KC to question for an hour each representing victim groups
  • - Legal teams for National Federation of Subpostmasters and Susan Sinclair to ask questions before lunch

general.title: Ex-AFL player Barry Cable charged with historical child sexual abuse offences
general.description:
• - Barry Cable, a former AFL player, has been charged with historical sex offenses against a young girl.
  • - Western Australian police allege that Cable sexually assaulted the girl when she was between nine and 10 years old in 1967 and 1968.
  • - The 80-year-old has been charged with five counts of indecent dealing with a girl under 13 and two counts of unlawful carnal knowledge of a girl under 13.

general.title: Kelly Rowland alleges racial profiling in Cannes film festival usher incident
general.description:
• - Kelly Rowland, from Destiny’s Child, confronted a Cannes film festival usher at the premiere of Marcello Mio.
  • - Rowland suggested she was racially profiled during the incident on the red carpet.
  • - She argued with a festival usher, pointing out the behavior she perceived as discriminatory.

general.title: Peruvian reporter who challenged political elite faces smear campaign
general.description:
• - Gustavo Gorriti, a Peruvian reporter known for exposing corruption for over 4 decades, is now facing a smear campaign.
  • - Gorriti's investigative work includes uncovering government corruption, such as in the Operation Car Wash scandal that implicated many Peruvian presidents.
  • - He gained recognition for reporting on the Shining Path conflict and was kidnapped during Alberto Fujimori's power grab after revealing Vladimiro Montesinos' activities.
  • - The criminal investigation against Gorriti is denounced as politically motivated by campaigners.

finance.title: Ex-Post Office boss agreed with PR who advised her to ditch review into 'past cases' to avoid 'front page news'
finance.description:
• - Ex-Post Office boss Paula Vennells agreed to drop reviews into "past cases" of sub-postmasters in 2013 based on advice from a PR adviser
  • - The PR adviser suggested this action would prevent media interest from escalating about the cases
  • - This revelation came to light during the Horizon IT inquiry.

finance.title: If Paula Vennells's first day was about ignorance, then day two made ignorance look like bliss
finance.description:
• - Paula Vennells faced public scrutiny on her second day in the witness stand.
  • - The second day was less dramatic but more substantial than the first.
  • - Vennells made further statements and provided insights during the inquiry.

finance.title: Ex-Nvidia recruiter’s No. 1 resume red flag: It makes you look like ‘there wasn't a whole lot of effort’
finance.description:
• - Ex-Nvidia recruiter Stefanie Fackrell warns against resume red flags
  • - Avoid listing daily job tasks on resume
  • - Use black ink for resume drafting
  • - Emphasize the importance of putting effort into your resume

finance.title: Stocks hit record again. Is Trump the reason?
finance.description:
• - Stocks reached all-time highs
  • - Trump is considered by many as the reason behind the market's success
  • - Stocks were rising when there was optimism about Hillary Clinton winning
  • - Janet Yellen and the Federal Reserve may also have contributed significantly to the market's growth

finance.title: Verizon's plan: Consumers win, investors lose
finance.description:
• - Verizon has reintroduced unlimited data plans for consumers.
  • - This move is beneficial for subscribers but negative for investors.
  • - The telecom industry's intense competition is highlighted by such decisions.
  • - Verizon's stock performance has been negatively impacted by the reintroduction of unlimited data plans.

finance.title: Ether slips after SEC opens the door to ether ETFs, still heads for best week in more than a year
finance.description:
• - Ether dropped on Friday after the SEC endorsed a rule change allowing ETFs to invest in the cryptocurrency
  • - Ether still on track for its best week in over a year

finance.title: Work Advice: An old co-worker is back and publicizing my cringey history
finance.description:
• - An individual is facing drama at their new workplace due to an old colleague publicizing a messy breakup with a co-worker from ten years ago.
  • - The old colleague's actions are causing discomfort and potentially damaging the individual's reputation.
  • - The individual is seeking advice on how to handle the situation and stop the gossip from spreading further.

finance.title: GM CEO Mary Barra says she has no plans to retire soon as automaker's transformation continues
finance.description:
• - GM CEO Mary Barra stated she has no plans to retire soon
  • - Barra emphasizes the importance of ensuring the company's transformation is on track

technology.title: Your earbuds and you: What all that listening is doing to us
technology.description:
• - Many people wear earbuds for extended periods, impacting hearing health.
  • - Host Manoush Zomorodi discusses headphone habits with exposure scientist Rick Neitzel.
  • - Neitzel collaborates with Apple on a study about daily sound exposure and listening habits' impact on hearing.
  • - Neitzel provides advice on safe listening practices for long-term ear protection.
  • - Discussion on the future of "consumer hearables" and tech companies' push for constant earbud usage.
  • - Interested individuals can join the Apple Hearing Study through the provided link.

technology.title: How Israel is using facial recognition in Gaza
technology.description:
• - Israel deployed facial recognition software in Gaza after Hamas attack
  • - Hundreds of thousands of Palestinians fled to the South of Gaza
  • - Palestinians reported passing through checkpoints with cameras
  • - Facial recognition system in Gaza launched late last year with private companies and Google's help
  • - Investigation led by The New York Times reporter Sheera Frenkel
  • - Science correspondent Geoff Brumfiel interviewed Frenkel about the facial recognition technology in Gaza

technology.title: What parents should know about the VR gear kids want
technology.description:
• - Guide to choosing virtual reality gear for families during the holidays.
  • - Includes options from Google Cardboard VR to Sony PlayStation VR.
  • - Helps determine suitable choices based on family interests, needs, and budget.

technology.title: Going to space is a real pain in the back
technology.description:
• - Astronauts on a six-month stay at the International Space Station experience back pain.
  • - The space environment can cause astronauts to temporarily gain up to 2 inches in height.
  • - However, this height gain is coupled with weakened muscles supporting the spine.

technology.title: TikTok creators sue U.S. government in a bid to stop potential ban
technology.description:
• - TikTok creators sued the U.S. government, claiming that potential ban violates their free speech rights under the 1st Amendment
  • - The law aims to compel Chinese owner ByteDance to sell the app

technology.title: Mike Tyson to fight Jake Paul. Yes, an ex-heavyweight champ is boxing a YouTuber on Netflix
technology.description:
• - Jake Paul, criticized for facing lesser opponents, is set to fight Mike Tyson, a boxing legend, who will be 58 years old during the July 20 match.
  • - The bout between the controversial YouTuber and the former heavyweight champion will be streamed on Netflix.

technology.title: Column: This was the year of AI. Next year is when you should worry about your job
technology.description:
• - Questions regarding job replacement by AI will become more pressing in the next year.
  • - Urgency and existential concerns regarding automation of work are rising.
  • - The article discusses the increasing impact of AI on job security and the imminent threat to various job sectors.

technology.title: An AI app claims it can detect sexually transmitted infections. Doctors say it's a disaster
technology.description:
• - Calmara app claims it can detect sexually transmitted infections from penis photos
  • - Doctors criticize the app, calling it a disaster
  • - Concerns raised about accuracy and ethical implications
  • - Medical experts warn against relying on such apps for diagnosis

health.title: Anti-abortion hardliners want restrictions to go farther. It could cost Republicans
health.description:
• - Abortion rights is a key political issue with increased intensity.
  • - Anti-abortion activists seek stricter restrictions and criminalization of patients.
  • - They aim to ban procedures like IVF.
  • - There is a potential cost for Republicans due to these extreme measures in the abortion debate.

health.title: 'It's a lot of UFO stuff and a lot of healing': Inside L.A.'s wackiest spiritual convention
health.description:
• - The Conscious Life Expo in Los Angeles has been a gathering place for individuals involved in astrology, channeling, aura reading, quantum life coaching, and other spiritual practices for 22 years.
  • - Participants at the expo include psychics, hypnotists, and "starseeds," who believe they are galactic volunteers helping humanity.
  • - The event features discussions on topics such as aliens, chakras, energy healing, and spirituality.
  • - Attendees have diverse beliefs and engage in activities focused on personal growth and healing.

health.title: Column: California wants to mandate folic acid in tortillas to help babies. Why that's bad
health.description:
• - California is considering mandating folic acid in tortillas to reduce birth defects.
  • - Folic acid helps prevent spinal cord and brain birth defects.
  • - Experts argue that mandating folic acid in tortillas could be ineffective and potentially harmful.
  • - Critics of the mandate suggest alternative methods to increase folic acid consumption.

health.title: He wasn't a crier, but then his wife died — and the tears wouldn't stop. How one father found his way forward
health.description:
• - Warren Kozak, after losing his wife, wrote a book about his experience.
  • - His book about loss turned out to be more about love.
  • - The article discusses how Kozak navigated grief and found a way forward.

health.title: Two men killed while pointing guns at the ground. Should police have waited?
health.description:
• - Police are trained to shoot when the threat is imminent, not necessarily when the gun is raised.
  • - Cognitive research suggests people should not be shot solely based on holding a gun at their side.
  • - Recent police killings in Florida and Alaska have prompted discussions about police encounters with armed individuals.

health.title: The 'soup for dinner' life: It's easy, delicious. A never-boring way to slim down
health.description:
• - Quick soups, simmering soups, and foolproof soups are highlighted as an easy method for home cooks to reduce calorie intake.
  • - The diet involving soups is described as a way to stay engaged and satisfied without getting bored.
  • - The article suggests that soup-based meals can assist in weight loss while being tasty and simple to prepare.

health.title: California is making fentanyl test strips free to organizations. How to get a kit
health.description:
• - California is providing free fentanyl-testing strips to eligible organizations across the state.
  • - The initiative aims to reduce synthetic opioid-related deaths.
  • - Organizations can request the free test strips through the state Department of Health Care Services.

health.title: An AI app claims it can detect sexually transmitted infections. Doctors say it's a disaster
health.description:
• - The Calmara app claims it can detect sexually transmitted infections (STIs) from photos of penises.
  • - Doctors criticize the app, stating that there are many issues with it.
  • - One doctor describes the app as a disaster.
  • - Calmara's accuracy and reliability in identifying STIs are questioned by medical professionals.

sports.title: The Boston Celtics become the first team to hit 30 wins this season with victory over the New Orleans Pelicans
sports.description:
• - The Boston Celtics are the first team in the NBA this season to reach 30 wins.
  • - They achieved this milestone by defeating the New Orleans Pelicans 125-114.
  • - The victory was driven by the performance of the team's key players, Jayson Tatum and Jaylen Brown, who scored a combined 72 points in the game.

sports.title: Arrow McLaren's Pato O'Ward confident as he dreams of first Indy 500 victory: 'We’ve got a shot'
sports.description:
• - Pato O'Ward of Arrow McLaren has come close to winning the past two Indy 500 races
  • - Despite previous setbacks, O'Ward remains confident in his chances for victory this weekend

sports.title: Why some of California's most outdoorsy people are moving to...Las Vegas?
sports.description:
• - Elite outdoor athletes are moving to Las Vegas for its proximity to outdoor activities.
  • - They are buying homes, starting families, and considering Las Vegas the adventure sports capital of the U.S.

sports.title: UFC president Dana White does not expect punishment for domestic violence incident
sports.description:
• - UFC president Dana White stated that he does not expect punishment for a domestic violence incident involving his wife.
  • - A video depicting White in a physical altercation with his wife surfaced earlier this month.
  • - White made the comments during a media day for UFC Fight Night 217.

sports.title: Three-time major winner admits to missing LIV golfers after PGA Championship, calls for solution between tours
sports.description:
• - Three-time major winner Padraig Harrington expresses missing LIV Golf players after PGA Championship.
  • - Calls for a solution to bridge the gap between tours in golf.

sports.title: Australia pulls out of Afghanistan cricket series over Taliban's restrictions on women
sports.description:
• - Australia's men's cricket team has pulled out of upcoming matches against Afghanistan in response to the Taliban's restrictions on women and girls' rights.
  • - Cricket Australia announced the decision, citing concerns over the rights of women, particularly in education and employment.
  • - The team's withdrawal is seen as a protest against the Taliban's policies on gender equality.
  • - The move comes amid growing international pressure on the Taliban to uphold human rights standards.

sports.title: Damar Hamlin has been released after spending more than a week hospitalized due to a cardiac arrest
sports.description:
• - Damar Hamlin released from hospital after more than a week following a cardiac arrest during "Monday Night Football."
  • - Buffalo Bills announced the news on Wednesday.

sports.title: Pelé's final hurrah at New York Cosmos helped spark 'sporting revolution'
sports.description:
• - Pelé's move to the New York Cosmos in the US helped ignite a revolution in soccer in North America.
  • - Despite already achieving immense success, Pelé's impact in transforming the sport was significant.
  • - The legendary player's influence extended beyond his on-field performance and contributed to the growth of soccer in the region.
  • - Pelé's involvement with the New York Cosmos marked a pivotal moment in the development of soccer in North America.

entertainment.title: The Real Housewife-ification of Congress; And, 25 years of being pilled by The Matrix
entertainment.description:
• - Representatives Marjorie Taylor Greene and Jasmine Crockett engaged in a heated exchange on the House floor
  • - Greene made a comment about Crockett's eyelashes, and Crockett referred to Greene's body as "butch"
  • - The article delves into the history behind these attacks, touching on issues such as misogynoir and transphobia
  • - The discussion also reflects on the expectations from politicians
  • - 'The Matrix' movie, released 25 years ago, is analyzed for its enduring relevance and appeal to different groups like trans people and incels who "took the red pill"
  • - The article explores the movie's core metaphor and its broad significance.

entertainment.title: 'Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga' goes full throttle
entertainment.description:
• - 'Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga' features bone-crunching stunts and diesel-powered chase scenes
  • - Directed by George Miller
  • - Prequel film starring Furiosa (Anya Taylor-Joy)
  • - Furiosa seeks revenge on an evil warlord (Chris Hemsworth)
  • - Themes of feminism, environmentalism, and humanity tackled in the movie

entertainment.title: Does 'The Sympathizer' worthily adapt its acclaimed book?
entertainment.description:
• - HBO's "The Sympathizer" is based on a Pulitzer Prize-winning novel and co-created by director Park Chan-wook.
  • - The series features Robert Downey, Jr. in four supporting roles.
  • - The show follows a character played by Hoa Xuande, who is both part of the South Vietnamese military and a spy for the North Vietnamese.
  • - The question posed is whether "The Sympathizer" is a worthy adaptation of its acclaimed book.

entertainment.title: 'Glass Onion' sharpens the 'Knives Out' formula in a polished Netflix sequel
entertainment.description:
• - "Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery" sharpens the 'Knives Out' formula in a Netflix sequel
  • - Maintains the razor-sharp formula of the successful predecessor
  • - Setup reminiscent of an Agatha Christie homage before clever twists
  • - Writer-director Rian Johnson assembles a solid cast behind Daniel Craig
  • - Emphasis on the use of language with no wasted words gives the sequel an edge

entertainment.title: In 'Wednesday,' Jenna Ortega makes Netflix's Addams Family series look like a snap
entertainment.description:
• - "Wednesday" is a new Netflix series featuring Jenna Ortega
  • - Jenna Ortega plays the now-high-school-age daughter of the Addams Family
  • - The character is portrayed as a cool, humorless goth sociopath
  • - The series is described as more kooky than spooky or ooky.

entertainment.title: 'Willow' revives the Lucasfilm fantasy with a more contemporary streaming adventure
entertainment.description:
• - Disney's "Willow" revival series on Disney+ brings back original star Warwick Davis.
  • - The revival series features a more contemporary narrative focusing on the next generation.
  • - The original 1988 movie is described as "beloved" in Disney's press materials.
  • - Despite being nostalgic, the original film is considered a generic George Lucas-plotted fantasy.
  • - The series provides a different take on the story, introducing new elements and characters.

entertainment.title: Does 'IF' capture the magic of its Pixar inspiration?
entertainment.description:
• - Movie IF features a 12-year-old girl who can see imaginary friends
  • - Stars Cailey Fleming, Ryan Reynolds, and directed by John Krasinski
  • - Blends real-world and animation
  • - Question raised on whether IF captures the magic of Pixar movies

entertainment.title: 'Love Actually' cast to reunite for 20th anniversary TV special
entertainment.description:
• - "Love Actually" cast members to reunite for a TV special
  • - The TV special will mark the 20th anniversary of the movie
  • - The romantic comedy "Love Actually" was released in 2003
  • - The reunion special will be aired on ABC next week, as announced by the network
